Headline: UI Library web timeline
Text: The Internet Archive's Wayback Machine is a fascinating tool to explore the history of the web, providing access to over 23 pentabytes of archived data. In honor of the updated UI Library website for Fall semester 2015, this timeline features the major redesigns over the last two decades.

Headline: First capture of UI Library website
Text: Tables were awesome and Netscape existed!

Headline: From Here You Can Go Anywhere!
This version lasted a long time...
Ask Us!
Text: Chat reference arrives and search with WorldCat.

Headline: Books & More
Text: Nice new tabbed search feature and map of the library.  Also, now you can text a librarian!

Headline: Responsive redesign
Text: Notice that some elements of this page were not captured by the web harvester. For example, the background image is missing and the twitter feed links to the live web. As designs have become more complex, archiving the web becomes more challenging.

Headline: U of I rebranding and major redesign
Text: In summer 2018 U of I updated its logos and color scheme, which set off a major redesign of the library website. The look mirrors the main university website, but retains its own unique theme. Underneath the technical stack was also updated, ensuring improvements to responsiveness and simplifying maintenance.

Headline: Gradual revisions
Text: The redesigned theme gradually evolved with new features and enhancements in response to feedback and analytics. The flexible static web approach allowed more library employees to directly contribute to creating and editing content. The percentage of users visiting the site from a mobile device continues to grow.

Headline: Ready for a redesign
Text: The content on the library website has continued to adapt to needs on campus, with more tutorials, updates, and features. The main university site launched with a redesigned theme, meaning the library will soon follow!
